results.title: Families: food and eating
results.creator_credit: George McQuilkin, James Kennedy, Jane Treiman and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Shows how the three families introduced in “Families: alike and different” obtain, prepare and eat their food. The Japanese buy in small shops and use chopsticks to eat fish, lotus root and rice. The Mexicans use a market and their own garden and use fingers to eat chicken stew. The Americans use cutlery to eat chicken, corn and salad from a supermarket.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George McQuilkin, James Kennedy, Jane Treiman and Churchill Films

results.title: Families: alike and different
results.creator_credit: George McQuilkin, James Kennedy, Jane Treiman and Churchill Films
results.brief_description: Compares the daily activities of three families from Japan, Mexico and the United States as told by the children. Shows the settings in which they live: a crowded Tokyo home, the San Francisco hills and the expansive rural three house compound of Yasalon.
results.creator_credit_for_label: George McQuilkin, James Kennedy, Jane Treiman and Churchill Films

results.title: Falklands: the story
results.brief_description: British whaling stations and meteorological outposts have operated in the Falklands for the past 40 years, but recently Argentina and Chile claimed the Islands on the basis of their geographical proximity.

results.title: Fakeers of the east
results.creator_credit: Van Beuren Corporation and RKO Radio Pictures
results.brief_description: Shows some amazing sleight of hand and other tricks by Indian Fakeers including the sname charm with two cobras and other animal tricks. Narration by Alois Havrilla.

results.title: Faithful departed
results.creator_credit: Kieran Hickey, Des Hickey and B.A.C. Films Ltd (Ireland)
results.brief_description: Life in Dublin in the early years of the 20th Century as shown in selected contemporary photographs. Discusses James Joyce’s early life and shows the setting of his novel Ulysses in the city as he knew it. Commentary by Jack MacGowran.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kieran Hickey, Des Hickey and B.A.C. Films Ltd (Ireland)

results.title: Fair dinkum in Russia
results.brief_description: Footage of what appears to be an amateur documentary by a member of the Australian Shooting Team that took part in the 37th World Shooting Championships in Moscow, 1958. No production details available. Silent film.

constellations_other.name: Pink, Pose, punk, Pilgrim
constellations_other.description: Alice Babidge's costume design for True History of the Kelly Gang sees the iconic foursome and their accomplices in dresses, a gender-expansive stance that connects to other rebellious outlooks on the world.

results.title: Facts about fish
results.brief_description: A study of the various types of fish including the tropical triggerfish; the ray, sole and plaice; sea sticklebacks, pipefish, sea horses, giant catfish, mirror and golden carp and small sturgeons; freshwater pike and perch.
results.description: A study of the various types of fish including the tropical triggerfish; the ray, sole and plaice; sea sticklebacks, pipefish, sea horses, giant catfish, mirror and golden carp and small sturgeons; freshwater pike and perch.

results.title: Facts about AIDS
results.brief_description: A short introduction to AIDS which attempts to dispel some of the myths surrounding the disease. In simple language the video explores what the HIV virus is, how AIDS develops and how the virus is transmitted. Suitable for use in class discussions with young adolescents.

results.title: Facing Up to Aids: sex in the '90s
results.brief_description: This documentary gives an insight into sex in the 90’s as a diverse range of people relate their attitudes and experiences and indicate how issues such as AIDS and safe sex have had an impact on their lives.
results.title_for_label: Facing Up to Aids: sex in the ‘90s
